overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research, publications, and job opportunities related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. Overall, LinkedIn boasts the highest follower count and engagement, while Bluesky shows a good balance of likes and reposts.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research findings, new publications, and methodologies in computational social science.
Content focusing on the study, detection, and mitigation of disinformation campaigns and information operations on social media.
Announcements of job openings, research grants, and opportunities for students and researchers.

recommendations: Increase cross-promotion of content across platforms to leverage the audience size of LinkedIn and drive traffic to other platforms.
Use platform-specific hashtags more effectively to increase discoverability and reach a wider audience.
Engage with followers by responding to comments and questions to build a stronger community and foster interaction.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky is a good platform for sharing research papers and conference presentations, attracting engagement through reposts. Consider using more visuals.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon posts generate relatively lower engagement compared to other platforms. Experiment with different content formats and posting times.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is highly effective for professional announcements and job postings, indicating a strong professional network. Continue to leverage this platform for career-related content.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
